The only difference between a black belt and a white belt is the black belt keeps coming back.

name: Mike Tucker
text: Instructors are very knowledgeable and patient with the students. We’ve been with the dojo for a little over a year and my son loves it!

name: Regina Bres
text: Great place! Everyone is so friendly and my son enjoys it very much

name: George Blackstone
text: Great dojo. Excellent instructors, my 12 year old has been coming for several years and he loves it.

name: Tossa Kim-Illes
text: My son has been here for a couple of years and we are very pleased with the instructors and the training he is receiving.  Not only do they learn martial arts, but they also learn to be focused, work as a team and be the best you can be. Many life lessons have been taught and can be carried on to all aspects of life.

name: Tyra Farris
text: We just love everything about the Bluff Park Dojo. The Senseis are fantastic at teaching to the student and not just the class. Our three children (8, 7, 4) are learning how to control both their bodies and minds. Being a part of such an organization has offered them responsibility, patience, and discipline. The tournaments are well run and super fun. We cannot recommend the dojo enough.

name: ابو مساعد Tareq saleh
text: Is the best and is changing the life for my son ‏ Next year my four year old son will be in there also with his brother

name: Sebastian German
text: USA Martial Arts is a great great place. Senseis are amazing and kids learn not only Martial arts but also discipline, respect and great values!!

name: Fredrick McHenry
text: My son was four (now five) when he started taking classes, after he told me that he wanted to learn karate. I can definitely say that I have seen some improvement in his ability to focus and pay attention. My daughter (eleven) is now taking classes as well. They both love and enjoy it. It is a great environment with fantastic teachers.

name: Brittany Yates
text: I'm not a parent of children that are students at this dojo, but I am the nanny of two children that have been at this dojo for at least a year now. I can't rave enough about the instructors and the lessons they teach these kids. It's more than just self-defense! They include a moral lesson each week, the value of respect and obedience of caregivers, and address issues such as bullying.

name: Katrina Stidham
text: We (my son) has been taking karate here for more than 2 years and I have never had a bad experience.  I feel like they truly love my son.  They are very encouraging and family-oriented.  You will not be disappointed.

name: Karen Burgess
text: Over 4 years ago I began my study of Aikido to be supportive of my spouse, who I’m proud to say just earned his black belt.  Not only have proven to myself your never to old to embark on a new journey, but I have formed fantastic friendships. Sensei teaches not only technique but respect & wisdom and how to incorporate martial arts in daily life.  I totally recommend Bluff Park Dojo to everyone of any age.

name: Heather Campbell
text: Our son has been taking karate classes here for a little over a year now and we could not be happier. Sensei Keith and the other instructors are so good with the kids, especially the younger ones. Our sons confidence has soared since starting these classes. The thing we love the most is that it’s not just about karate here. It’s about discipline, respect and responsibility that trickles over into their home life. The way they behave in the dojo should be the same way they behave at home and Sensei holds them accountable. Would highly recommend them to anyone we know.

name: John Mason
text: Great place for learning more than just the martial arts...lessons for life!

name: Suzanne Jones
text: My son is enrolled in the Little Dragons program, and it is so much more than I had expected when we started a few months ago.  The kids learn about responsibility, respect, and discipline in a caring and fun environment.  Sensei McConkey and Sensei Hood are amazingly good at communicating with the young kids - they really bring out the best in each student and the kids have a blast.  It's the perfect length for little ones also.

name: Tosha Sawyer
text: Our family loves USA Martial Arts!  Our girls started as soon as they turned 4 and have learned so much,  self- confidence, manners,  what to do in scary situations or if ever bullied.  Sensei MacConkey is a great mentor and our girls never want to miss a class!

name: JACOB KING
text: USA martial arts has been my home for 10 years now ands it’s built my character and made me who I am today, there isn’t a better program or training instructor to help in your training

name: Brandi Sherman
text: We love this dojo. The instructors are amazing, great attention to detail and good class size!

name: Secretsandman
text: Great place to train. The instructors are wonderful. I've been training here for a year and some months and I'd say it was one of the best choices I made in joining their ranks. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking to learn martial arts.

name: Love Them Train Them LLC
text: The instructors here are FANTASTIC. There are usually at least three instructors present for the kids, which typically results in 1 instructor for every 2-3 students! Every week they conclude with a fun game that reinforces the skills they are learning. This isn't a "workout class" like some others, they are learning GENUINE aikido and judo. I have told many friends about USA Martial Arts... we have tried several places and they are the best!!

name: William Monroe
text: We love everything about USA Martial Arts! Sensei MacConkey and Sensei Hood are not only amazing and well disciplined in their art, but are gracious and encouraging to me and my children in the program! Their skill and patience are a beauty to see. My girls look forward to class each week and cannot wait to share their accomplishments with their Senseis and friends. This program allows reiteration of awareness, discipline, and working as a team that I strive to teach my kids. As a homeschooling mom, having another supportive source that isn’t mom or dad has been so encouraging. Currently in the Little Dragons program and plan to be here for years to come!

name: Lindsay Moore
text:
We were not sure if our 4 year old daughter would be a good fit for karate....after all, she will only wear dresses, at all times, day and night. To top it off, she was the youngest in her class.
Sensei MacConkey and Sensei Hood made her feel comfortable and continued to encourage her in every class. The weekly lessons to strengthen our daughter's moral compass warm my heart. It feels like these instructors are on our team helping to develop our daughter to be the best she can be.
I would highly recommend this dojo!!!

name: Gowtham Prakash Chereddy
text: This is not the place where you just learn Martial Arts, This is the place where you develop your Inner Peace under the Guidance of Sinse MacConkey.

name: rcksngr
text: Children usually have one or two teachers who make a positive, long-lasting impact on their lives. I have a very strong feeling that Sensei MacConkey and his team will do that for my two children. At USA Martial Arts - Bluff Park Dojo, my children are learning much more than just excellent quality martial arts. They are also learning discipline, respect, self confidence, teamwork, self control, and many other beneficial personal qualities that will last a lifetime. If you are considering martial arts for yourself or your family, look no further than Bluff Park Dojo.

name: john livinston
text: The best teachers for your child you can find!! I can’t express how pleased I am with them and what they teach my child, and it goes well passed karate and into morals and how to be a good person to others. Go for yourself to one class and you will see what I mean. I have not seen one child or parent that does not love this place and the people that are associated with it.

name: Robert Sorge (Flowboy)
text: My son loves the classes and the instructors. They really make learning martial arts fun! The perfect mix of fun and serious training. Would highly recommend!

name: Heather Wallis
text: My son has been taking lessons at this dojo for the last three years, and we absolutely love it! The instructors are not only incredibly knowledgeable and skilled, but they are kind, engaging, and seek to make each child feel welcome and valued. Their goal is not just to improve each child's physical condition and knowledge of martial arts, but to help them become young men and women of character, integrity, and excellence in all they do.

name: Chad Frazier
text: Excellent place to study martial arts. Class sizes ensure you are able to receive individual instruction.  Teachers are patient and super knowledgeable. Highly recommended!

name: KrisAndDanielle Jaje
text: Enrolling my son in the Little Dragons program at USA Martial Arts Bluff Park Dojo is one of the best decisions we've made. Not only does he love going and working toward a goal (belts and stripes for behavior in the Little Dragons program), it has also helped him become more self controlled, focused while listening, and respectful of those around him. Senseis MacConkey and Hood are excellent and patient teachers and I love the ethics and moral lessons they incorporate into the class each week. They expect the students to be attentive and respectful, and I can see how their guidance is helping my son develop into a more disciplined student at the dojo and at his regular school. They also have a lot of fun! My son loves the exercises, skills, and games they plan each week and he is always excited to go. He enjoys learning how to count and say some phrases in Japanese and Korean, as well. As a parent, I appreciate the lessons in self defense my son is learning. While we hope they will never be needed in real life scenarios, they are skills that are useful to know. We are very happy with our experience at this dojo and highly recommend it!

name: Edgewood Dance
text: Bluff Park Dojo stands out with its authentic, dynamic, purposeful and joyful programs. As an owner and director of a dance institute, I sought a dojo in Birmingham that would diversify my professional dancers’ experiences in movement through authentic Aikido training. Within a single conversation, it was evident to me that this dojo held the highest standards of excellence and integrity in its art. I immediately enrolled my two children in their Little Dragons program, which has dramatically impacted their life in many positive ways. I am grateful to the Sensei at Bluff Park Dojo for the influential role they have on my dancers and my children each and every day. Thank you!

name: Pep Sawyer
text: Awesome experience.  We enrolled Lallie & Raleigh both within days of them turning 4yo.  Raleigh just turned 6 and Lallie will be 8 in a few weeks.  Sensei MacConkey has a knack for being able to interact with each student in a way that fits their individual strengths & weaknesses making sure to always lift them up in their endeavors.  We strongly believe that bringing any child up with strong self-confidence and strong self-discipline are very important, but especially with young girls & women.  We couldn't be happier or recommend USA Martial Arts more highly.

name: Arden Campbell
text: I have been taking classes here for almost 8 and a half years now and I could not be happier with this dojo. The environment is comfortable and welcoming and all the instructors are extremely nice. Sensei MacConkey is the best sensei anyone could possibly ask for. He has taught me courage, honour, confidence, self control, and so much more. I don't know where I would be without this dojo.

name: Maria
text:
Definitely 5 a star rating and here's why:
1. Kid friendly.The instructors, Sensei Keith and Sensei Wyatt, are awesome with the kids! Patient, kind, and good with small kids (we are in the Little Dragons Program). They gently redirect kids when they need to refocus in class and do it with ease. They know how to speak to little ones and meet them on their level.
2. Communication. They are great at communicating with the parents. We get calendars and text updates when any changes occur, etc. Feedback: Every week, parents fill out a progress sheet and sensei gives a shout out to them at the end of practice when they get their new stripe. This makes my kid feel awesome because he gets to hear from someone outside of our family on how awesome he is. They are great role models for little ones in class. PS- my son got such a sweet shout out on his birthday from sensei in class. He was called upon many times in class to answer up and demonstrate new sills. This is just one example of how they recognize and encourage our kids. My son is one of the younger ones so it was nice to see him get recognized even though he was not the highest belt or most skilled in class.
3. I like what I see happening at the dojo...Team spirit, kids interacting with their peers, lots of POSITIVITY, focus manners and answering up, and new skills/ techniques being taught each week. There is always emphasis placed on safety when learning new skills and practicing them. P.S. go online and read The Little Dragon Pledge. Kids are not just learning about a sport; they are learning and developing so much more than this. We have been involved for a approx a year and have no intentions on leaving. In fact, I feel like this is a sport we will stick with because of everyrhing my son gets out of it.

Thanks to everyone at the dojo for all you guys do for our kids throughout the year. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year to the staff, kids, and parents!!!

name: Sheri Snow
text: Best instruction in Birmingham. My son has been a student for almost 6 years. The instructors are top notch in both martial arts and in their delivery of meaningful and lasting life skills. My son will continue to benefit from this experience.

name: Steven
text:
Bluff Park Dojo is an excellent place for children as well as adults to learn martial arts. The instructors are absolutely fabulous. I can't say enough about how much they have done for our daughter in the program. For children they not only teach a strong foundation in martial arts self-defense but also teach obedience, discipline, respect, and safety. It is a great place for physical -- as well as mental -- exercise and fitness. Also, the class sizes for instructor to student ratio are excellent.

Watching our daughter grow in the program for a year also inspired my wife and I to join the adult program. If you're looking for a traditional martial arts dojo that teaches well rounded self-defense, I highly recommend USA Martial Arts. The dojo specializes in karate, tae kwon do, aikido, judo, and iaido. The instructors are extremely patient and work with you one-on-one. The environment is very welcoming and everyone (instructors and students) are all always willing to help others learn. I feel fortunate to have such an experienced group to learn from near where we live. Also, for adults it is a great outlet for fitness/exercise, de-stressing, mental focus, improving flexibility and balance (that includes work/life balance as well).

The instructors are truly passionate about teaching. They love what they do, and it definitely shows. I cannot recommend Bluff Park Dojo enough.

name: TRISTAN DUONG
text: I have been taking classes at this amazing dojo for more than 4 years and I love it! The instructors are good at educating people and are very nice. I love this place and plan on staying here.

name: Ashley Dark
text: We LOVE USA Martial Arts!  Their Little Dragons program is top notch. They balance martial arts with good character.  Highly recommend them!

name: Kacia McHenry
text: Great instructors. They really have the patients it takes to engage and control younger children. The instructors are very nice. You will not be disappointed if your child goes here. Awesome training.

name: Ahmed Elhattab
text:
Ok! I wanted to write this post since a while.
This place is wonderful, and I believe it is the best place for your kids. My kid has been doing Martial Arts for two years now, the first year was in different place and we were going to quit because of them.
But, since he started in US Martial Arts he changed so much. The sensei focuses with every single kid during the session. They make training in form of fun and kids really like it.
Most importantly, every session they make an evaluation for the kid acts during the week. The parents used to tell the sensei how was the kid doing during the week so the sensei reward the kid. My kid really cares about it, he started to clean his room and taking care of his brothers.
If you want to teach your kids Martial arts and you are in Birmingham, do not go anywhere else. I have tried many and they are the best of the best.

name: S Campbell
text: Wonderful Dojo to grow your martial arts skills and your family.  Sensei MacConkey offers multiple  disciplines; Karate, Taekwondo, Iaido, Judo, and Aikido. Plus leadership skills, character development, confidence building, life coaching, nutritional guidance. A great place for the journey on the path to a better you!

name: Jill Meyer
text: My 6 year old tried other programs but this was the best fit for us. Very happy with the smaller class sizes and instruction. The staff have all been very patient and encouraging while teaching both martial arts & important life skills.

name: Catie Kesterson
text: We are so pleased with our son’s experience at USA Martial Arts! We would highly recommend their program to other parents. Everyone is serious and committed to what they do, but at the same time they care about each of their students.

name: Cherie Fairburn
text: Our son has been taking martial arts here for 1 year, and it is absolutely the best dojo in the Birmingham area. He has previously taken karate at 2 other schools, one in the Birmingham area and the other in another state at a chain that also had a location in Birmingham. USA Martial Arts has been the best experience by far. Our son, who is a teenager, wanted "more authentic" martial arts instruction than his prior dojos. The instructors here definitely teach true martial arts, not just an exercise class. They are very skilled and patient. What we truly love is that they not only teach martial arts, but life lessons that will carry over to everything they do. We also love how welcoming everyone - instructors and other students - is to new students. We have been extremely happy with every aspect of our experience here, and highly recommend USA Martial Arts.

name: craig warren
text: I have been training at USAMA for 15 years. Best school in Alabama no question. Many different arts are taught here so a student can learn many different techniques.

name: Lindsey Durie
text: The Little Dragons program has been great for our family. My son and daughter love their class- a great combination of physical fitness, life skills and fun.

name: sandraandjim
text: Our family highly recommends this Dojo to anyone who is interested in training in Martial Arts!  We love the instructors who have been important parts of our children’s lives.  There is a wonderful community feel to the dojo that only seems to grow as students progress through the ranks.  The instructors have a gift for knowing when to challenge, encourage, work, and take time for fun/team building drills.  It is obvious that they really care about their students!

name: Thomas Brown
text: My son and I attend classes here and it is a GREAT location to learn martial arts. From the instructors to the other students, everyone is welcoming and you feel like part of a family.

name: Meghan Bedwell McKenzie
text:
I have been taking my son to USA Martial Arts for almost 3 years. He is so motivated by the teachers and staff that he has decided that he, too, wants to become a black belt. This program emphasizes not only discipline, kindness, and respect in the dojo, but in every day life. I am so glad that we are a part of the USA Martial Arts family.

I'm just going to add to this... a year later I am still so tickled by this place.
I cannot say enough wonderful things about USA Martial Arts.  My son has been attending for over 4 years and I have seen him grow in his practice and as a little human as well.  Keith, Wyatt and the rest of the team are patient, kind, thoughtful, diligent, tenacious and consistent... I cannot think of enough kind things to say about this place (and the people there).  Becoming a part of our dojo family will be the best decision you make!

name: Melissa Hamley (thehamleyfamily)
text: I first signed my son up for karate here in January of 2010, and at the time, I had no idea how life-changing that decision would be.  Sensei Keith MacConkey has been a vital part of the lives of both of my children ever since -- instilling in them a sense of respect, hard work, attention to detail, and leadership.  I cannot say enough great things about this place!

name: slimerv
text: I’ve enjoyed my experience at USA Martial Arts. The instructors are friendly and positively encourage all students while teaching the fundamentals of the arts. All students receive  special attention from the instructors during class.

name: Joni Hammond
text: We just started attending at the dojo, but on the first visit we were warmly welcomed all my questions were answered, and my son really enjoyed it.  The teachers are very polite and from the three sessions we have been to, work so great with the children.  They learn so much in the time they are there and enjoy it.  We are looking forward to some great years ahead at this dojo and recommend it for sure!

name: Ash RQ
text: USA Martial Arts is an amazing dojo with an incredibly talented and caring staff. My children have been there for 2 years and the classes at USA Martial Arts have given them an awesome amount of confidence and many great lessons learned. I can’t recommend them enough!

name: Bo Guthrie
text: You'll get excellent instruction. More than that, you'll get a community of kind hearted, caring people. I can't recommend this place enough.

name: Eddie Freyer
text: A great program for students of all ages.  Our son has been involved for years and it's been a key part of his development as a young man.  Can't say enough good things about the dojo, the instructors and the community surrounding this program.

name: TJ Zito Jr
text:
Highly recommend. Excellent instruction. Our son has learned so much and his discipline at home has improved. The sensai's are very patient, but at the same time really care about discipline. I see enrolling our son a few years ago as one of the best decisions we have done for him.....not to mention he really has a lot of fun with it. This has helped his confidence so much. The best thing is this is a private owned business. This is not a national "Chain" and your kid gets individual attention---and actually has to earn their results. The belts are not "handed" to them--they must earn them properly. I really like that....Our son earns what he does....

Payment is handled very easily through direct debit.  I love all of the "extras" such as the yearly family picnic, "Night of the Ninja" where the kids spend the night at the dojo, specialty workshops, and tournaments.  Everything is always scheduled spot on and organization I would also give five stars!

name: Andrew Gray
text: USA Martial Arts has been a phenomenal for my son. We started as Little Dragons and he is now coming up to testing for his 6th rank advancement. The smaller class sizes are very beneficial. It allows them to get more individual trading. All of the Senseis are wonderful and deeply care for their students. They emphasize the whole "With Great Power, Comes Great Responsibilty" saying.

name: Valarie Campbell
text: This dojo and it's instructors have been a tremendous blessing to our family. Values, confidence, responsibility are all part of the culture of USA Martial Arts. We love our dojo!

name: CL Morrow
text: I've only been going to USA Martial Arts for a little less than a year, but I can't imagine not going already. It's an amazing school staffed by dedicated, caring and highly-skilled instructors. Attending Aikido and Karate/Taekwondo classes at the dojo is the highlight of my day, and I leave every night with a smile on my face having gotten a great workout and having spent time with the awesome students and teachers that make this school so unique. You will never regret choosing USA Martial Arts!

name: Chris Tomberlin
text: I cannot recommend this dojo highly enough for both children and adults! I began my training here in 2008 as a white-belt and have been here ever since.The teaching is excellent and the spirit of the place is one of kind confidence. Sensei MacConkey is great with the kids and teaches them discipline, respect and valuable martial arts skills. The adults get to have fun while getting in shape and learning practical self defense skills. It's a friendly and comfortable atmosphere - come join us!

name: Jeff Mann
text: We love USA Martial Arts! Their adult Aikido program is fantastic and our children have grown up in the junior program. From 4 year olds in Little Dragons through advanced juniors, our children have loved it. The teachers use positive reinforcement which builds self esteem and confidence while also teaching responsibility. The emphasis here is always on being a better person and treating others well. Can’t say enough wonderful things about Sensei and his team.

name: Patrick Davis
text:
This is the finest dojo in Birmingham and if you are considering enrolling your son or daughter into a journey to master the discipline of karate....you must visit this very special place.

For almost 5 years we have passed several other dojos that would have been easier with our busy schedules. It was never considered because of the environment at USA Martial Arts. Sensei MacConkey is the best instructor not just in martial arts but in the discipline of shaping young minds. The entire staff is dedicated and the school exposes their students to multiple forms of karate and judo. This one of a kind environment will become a big part of your child’s life and they will be better for it.

name: wendy zito
text: My son has taken from sensai for several years. The level of instruction is amazing. Plus the attention and care that sensai shows for his students is incredible. He encourages them to be their best selves and uses what he teaches them to be the best version of themselves. My son Jay is always complimented on his manners and that has everything to do with the respect and self discipline that sensai teaches his students. Sensai teaches the kids so much. Please consider USA martial arts for your child. You and your child will be better because of it.

name: Martha Hughes
text: I first began training at USA Martial Arts in 1992 under the instruction of Shehan Van Bushnell.  The level of instruction was outstanding.  Several years ago when Sensei Keith MacConkey took over the quality of instruction continued to be the highest there is.  It seems the program just continues to improve every year.  I can’t say enough good about USA Martial Arrs.

name: Charles Monroe
text: My son has been training for a year with Sensei MacConkey. He has learned so much during that time improving his listening skills, discipline, and of course skills in Aikido/Judo. He has so much fun his jealous younger sister also joined. Of course she is most excited to have a chance to practice throwing him!

name: Kelly Jones
text:
Here we are 2 years later and this place is still doing a fantastic job with my boys. Not only are they learning karate but they are also learning self respect, respect for other, discipline and motivation. The instructors are dedicated to teaching with encouragement and praising for a job well done. We love USA Martial Arts and are thankful for this place!

I have been very impressed with this dojo. I signed my son up here because my husband learned at the same dojo under a different instructor. But now after him taking just a few short months, I am blown away at what he has learned so far. Not only is he learning karate to be able to defend himself, but I am seeing respect for others that he is learning from his instructor as well. Best decision we have made reguarding a sport for our children.

name: Sally Morriss
text: USA Martial Arts in Bluff Park is an amazing place! They offer a variety of martial arts disciplines including Karate/taekwondo, Aikido, Judo, and Iaido. The instructors are excellent in their knowledge and their techniques. Not only do they teach the martial forms , but also teach about the origins and history of the various arts. They are always welcoming and helpful and offer classes for children, teens and adults. I started in karate and now take aikido and Iaido there. I highly recommend this school.

name: Councilman Casey Middlebrooks
text: Sensei Keith and staff are absolutely amazing with kids; we have a 6 year old son who attends the Bluff Park Dojo.  The instructors blend education, entertainment, and discipline seamlessly. Highly recommend.

name: Gary Grimes
text: Our daughter had a good experience here

name: Michele Mulder
text:
I do not think I can write enough to say how much our family loves USA Marital Arts! My son is 12 and has been attending USA Martial Arts since August 2015. Sensei MacConkey is truly a master teacher, in my opinion. He exhibits true love and concern for all of his students but also knows when to discipline correctly. I call it a praise sandwich. He will correct their mistakes but always surround it with praise for the things that are correct. He requires discipline and hard work, and his students know it. My son trusts Sensei and that makes me feel good as a parent. I trust him because he also surrounds himself with good instructors and helpers (students). His staff is truly top notch! My son NEVER wants to miss class. We will do anything to get him there even if it is calling friends when the car is broken down! I do not know how there could be a better place for my child than USA Martial Arts!

UPDATE: I am updating my post to say that we are still extremely happy with my son's training at USA Martial Arts. My son has become a better young man because of Keith MacConkey. Do not delay in taking your child to this dojo!

name: Russell Shamburger
text: Fun learning environment for all ages.

name: Ibtihal Osman
text: The best place ever

name: Christopher Moss
text: I have two sons who attend. Master Newsom is an awesome instructor.

name: taylor coleman
text: The instructor is amazing! Everyone is super helpful. Definitely recommend NextGen for all ages.

name: Melanie Dutremble
text: My son recently joined Next Gen Martial Arts and we are very pleased. Master Newsom is an amazing instructor. He is kind, compassionate, and soft spoken, yet his discipline is motivational and respected. My son is consumed with his encouragement and instruction. He wants to come every day. Five Stars :)

name: C Man
text: My son has been going to NextGen since shortly after it opened and just recently received his black belt. As a parent I enjoyed watching it so much that I wanted to join myself which I did around 3 years ago and I will receive my black belt next month! NextGen is great for any age. There is so much to learn and it is great fun. All members are very nice and it is amazing how mature all of the kids are!

name: Anthony Varnadore
text: Awesome training for all ages. I have enjoyed the one-on-one  and group training that I have receive from NextGen.  The professionalism and personal attention that Todd Newsom  gives to all of his student is outstanding. Next Gen  is affordable and safe for any member of your family. Me and my son both joined to have something to do together. Next Gen has made that a success.

name: Heather Lucas
text: We love Next Gen! We are a part of the Little Dragons program at Next Generation Martial Arts and could not imagine being anywhere else! Master Todd Newsom has a wonderful program with various age groups-both boys and girls. He has a wonderful rapport with all of his students! Super family friendly studio!

name: Deet Scott
text: NextGen Martial Arts has been a huge boost to my four kids' fitness, confidence and leadership. We have experienced a culture of hard work, integrity,  encouragement among the students and teachers alike. Each child is treated as an individual so that there is a place for the serious competitor as well as those who just enjoy the friendships and athleticism of martial arts training. We've been associated with the school since it opened; it's exciting to be a part of the continual pursuit of excellence at NextGen.

name: Hoyt Troglen
text: Our son has been a member for over 2 years and has enjoyed every minute! The training and character building have made such a difference in him. I encourage you, if you are looking for a great place to train for martial arts to go NextGen!

name: Kiyah Castro
text: We absolutely LOVE the work that Master Newsome does with the kids! My son has gained so much confidence over the past few months and has really come out of his shell. Thank you for all that you do! #NextGen

name: Jeannie Jones
text: We have trained at several schools (we are military), and NextGen has given my boys more opportunities than I could have ever imagined. The atmosphere is friendly, the instruction is both technical and fun, and the facility is modern and clean. We have had opportunities to train with World Champions, my kids have learned discipline and perseverance, and we have made lifelong friends there. We actually drive 40 minutes to train at NextGen....come check it out!

name: Melissa Boyle
text: NextGen Martial Arts and Master Newsom are amazing. We have been attending almost 3 years and my daughter has gained so much confidence, so many skills  and most importantly she has fun in a wonderful environment. Five stars aren't enough.

name: HC Youngblood
text: NextGen Martial Arts in an excellent martial arts school that goes above and beyond standard martial arts training. They provide a myriad of classes for all interests and age levels, special training opportunities with world-class champions, intense (and fun!) summer training camps, and an environment that promotes a sense of community and true encouragement among instructors and fellow students. Master Newsome teaches students so much more than the physical aspects of martial arts; he teaches them the value of respect for themselves and others, hard work, perseverance, humility and integrity…all while having fun and learning high quality martial arts skills!

name: Christy Glenn
text: If you are looking for a great place to learn Martial Arts - NextGen is the place!! They welcome all ages. Our 5 & 6 1/2 year old look forward to classes and always want to improve.  Master Newsome is a great instructor who takes time with all of his students.

name: Heather K.
text: Master Newsom is really great working with children, but he has a good group of adults learning martial arts as well! My family had a great experience here.

name: Melinda PEEVY
text: We love nextgen!  A wonderful environment where we felt like "family" from the very first visit.  Martial arts and yoga instruction are top notched!!

name: jared thompson
text: Master Newsom is amazing with young children and beginners. The progress my six year old has made in less than a year is a testament to his patience and skill. I will definitely be bringing my 3 year old to Master Newsom when he is old enough.

name: Kim Bowen
text: Master Newsom is ah-mazing. If you're looking for a great place to go that you won't be judged for not being perfect, this is the place. Everyone here is awesome. The environment is great, and everyone is super helpful to their fellow ninjas. Love my NextGen!

name: TB
text: Master Newsom is great with the kids and NextGen Martial Arts is a top notch training facility.  My son thoroughly enjoys his lessons and his confidence builds with each class!!

name: Sarah Little
text: Love this place!! Great place for learning and fun. Wish I would have found it sooner!

name: Jamie Crockett
text: My two boys have been students of Master Newsom since they were able to join the Lil Dragons class.  We can't say enough about Master Newsom and the way he runs his studio.  If your kids are interested in karate, try out NextGen.  You won't be disappointed!

name: B
text: Wouldn't want my kid anywhere else!!!!

name: Amy Manley
text: NextGen is the best place around to train in martial arts at ANY age! Master Newsom is awesome!

name: Jimmy Brown
text: I recently started my Martial Arts training at NextGen and absolutely love it! I reached out to an old high school friend for a recommendation to a class in Tri county area, she only referred one, NextGen!! Chief Instructor, Todd Newsom, immediately made me feel welcomed as well as his awesome staff and fellow Martial Arts Students. I'm on the north side of fifty years old and was apprehensive to begin this journey; however, to my surprise, Tang Soo!!! Get off the couch and come join!

name: Christy Haire
text: We have been very impressed overall with NextGen Martial Arts.  Check it out... you will be glad you did!

name: Skip Nichols
text: When I moved to Prattville, I wanted to find a quality facility to restart my Martial Arts training. Master Newsom and his facility are second to none. Definitely the best value in Prattville. The classes are tremendous. Master Newsom welcomes students from other styles of Martial Arts and the classes are very thorough without being judgmental. They treat you like family from day one.

name: Melinda Caffee
text: We have been at Nextgen Martial Arts for almost a year now. It has a wonderful positive and upbeat atmosphere. Master Newsom is a very knowledgeable instructor that not only teaches the traditional Tang Soo Do but the Hyper XMA weapons and kick tricking.  There are so many classes to choose from my daughter never wants leave. If you are looking for a friendly, clean and Christian environment for your child or whole family, this is the place to call home.

name: Chris Lewis
text: Great school and instructors.

name: Gina Daniel
text: Gracie my instructor is knowledgeable and awesome!!  Facility is very nice! I enjoy very much taking classes here.

resp.text: Thank you, Gina! We enjoy working with you and are glad you're enjoying your training. Keep up the hard work!

name: Laura Rivers
text:
I am ecstatic for the opening of this local Madison “gem”! Gracie and Isaac truly go above and beyond. They are both, very knowledgeable and very passionate about the self-defense style that they teach.

If you are expecting this to be a “wax on, wax off” type of karate, think again! The personalized lesson was practical and relatable without having to paint a fence. And a HUGE bonus, both instructors are patient and encouraging! It’s absolutely all you could ask for in when it comes to learning self-defense!

resp.text: Thank you Laura! We enjoy having you in the studio and know you'll do great things.

name: Bart Roegner
text: Isaac is an excellent teacher. He approaches teaching martial arts with patience and dedication. I highly recommend trying Kenpo with MadCity.

resp.text: Thanks, Bart! We really enjoy teaching you and appreciate your dedication.

name: Matthew Eady
text: An amazing school that teaches a very effective system of self-defense.  Patient, caring instructors who take time to pay the necessary attention to each individual student.  Great for people of all ages and all levels of physical fitness.  I could not recommend a better Kenpo in the North Alabama area.

resp.text: Thanks, Matt! We really enjoy teaching you and love getting to share our art with this area.

name: Randall Rivers
text: Great experience.  I wanted personal training, not a big group.  They offer several different options so you can find the one that works for you.  Good central location, nice facility and friendly, experienced trainers. I really like their focus on practical self-defense.

resp.text: Thanks, Randall! We think you'll excel quickly in our private program. We can't wait to see your progress.

name: Christopher Weaver
text: Amazing place! The instructors are friendly and very detailed in what they reach you.

resp.text: Thanks Christopher! We're glad you're enjoying your training so far - we appreciate all the hard work you put in.

name: Farida Rennie
text: I just took my first self defense lesson and I absolutely loved it. I felt that the lesson was not only fun but also practical. I was able to get a good workout while leaving with skills and improving my balance. I've already signed up for my next session!

resp.text: Thanks, Farida!! We appreciate your desire to learn and can not wait to see your growth in Kenpo.

name: SJ Donahue
text: I really had high hopes for this camp and do think that overall it is good.  We became a little frustrated as summer camp went on, that they require DAILY extra cash of $5.  That really ends up becoming quite expensive on top of the initial price, I can't imagine having multiple kids there!  While I think the occasional field trip is fun for a change, I felt like some times this was used unnecessarily.  This information was also not told up front, but after signing up in the paperwork required.  Extra money for field trips, snacks, pizza parties, gas for the vans?!, etc.  Honestly, this is what changed our mind from doing the After School Program.  Also keep in mind the After School Program change: initially they said there would be homework time, Jiu Jitsu/tumbling/gymnastics practice, and an active game (we thought, perfect, not on devices!).  This has now changed to field trips again with daily fees and less emphasis on JJ, with no word of homework time.  It's basically 2-2.5 hours, why are multiple field trips expected???  Again - overall good, I believe they are trying, but I think they have moved away from some of the initial appeal of these programs.

resp.text: SJ! Thank you for your honest feedback! We strive to improve our programs on a daily basis!! Randall

name: Mike Fetsch
text: Staff is awesome and really cares about your individual experience. Learned teachers means a wide variety of techniques taught. Facilities are great, and everyone is inclusive and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you sir! Randall

name: Colin Mitchell
text: I’ve been training BJJ here for years. Gym atmosphere is very positive, and all management and instructors are very professional. Staff and members go out of their way to make newbies feel welcome. Couldn’t recommend more!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!! Randall

name: Amie Brown
text: My son loves this summer program! It's amazing to be able to go to work with the peace of mind that my son is in good hands and having so much fun!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!!

name: Jackson Swartz
text: Very friendly and inclusive staff, it’s a fun way to stay active.

resp.text: Jake!! Thank you!! See you tonight 7 pm no gi bjj at aumma!! Randall

All of the coaches, owners and members keep a family atmosphere and culture in the gym that allows you to feel comfortable to ask questions, trust each other and build friendships quickly. I highly recommend Auburn BJJ.

resp.text: thanks!!!

name: Andrew D'Amico
text: Dropped in for a class while visiting Auburn. They were awesome. Great instruction and fantastic culture. Had a great time and will definitely drop in again when I’m back in Auburn...War Eagle!

name: Clinton Lothrop

resp.text: Man, thanks!!!

resp.text: Oh man! thanks for the kind words! We miss seeing ya'll!

name: Nikki Richardson
text: My kids have really enjoyed their experience here so far. We hope to continue going here for many years to come. The teachers are great with them! My oldest is 8 he’s learning a lot and so interested in it. He’s very shy but learning to open up more.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Nathan White
text: Great family atmosphere, where everyone is working to help you succeed.

text: For our son's 3rd birthday in June, he said he wanted to be like a ninja turtle. The best we could do was sign him up for Jiu Jitsu. He has been in class for about 3 weeks and loves it! So far, we love it!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

text: It's a place where strangers become like family, everyone helps one another get better and progress as one. My 5 year old also loves it and he just started. Hopefully my wife follows us too! Everyone should definitely give it a try.

text: I've been a member here for about 3 years.  I had no previous experience in martial arts, but Randall, Steven and the other staff are great instructors.  Now I only attend the open mat times and we all help each other keep improving.  It's not only a great place to learn BJJ, but also to make some solid friendships.

resp.text: thanks buddy!

name: Patrick Morgan
text: If you are looking to change your life, get in great shape and have fun while doing it, become a member of Auburn Jiu Jitsu. You will not find better instructors who care about you as an individual. I have been a member for nearly 3 years and my one regret is that I didn't start training Jiu Jitsu earlier. So, what are you waiting for. Make that phone call or drop by and get started today!

resp.text: Thanks Patrick!!!

name: Kounte Threadgill
text: There are many reasons why I would recommend Auburn Jiu Jitsu but the two most important reasons are the dedication and patience of all the instructors. They really do want to help your child learn and become an outstanding individual on and off the mat. My son started here over a year ago and his self confidence has grown tremendously. I would tell anyone that this is most definitely the place to be!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!

name: Nathan Southerland
text: Randall and the staff are amazing! It doesn’t matter your ability they work with everyone to help them learn and enjoy Jiu Jitsu. Starting your journey here is a great decision.

resp.text: Thanks Nathan for the kind words!

name: Paul Medina
text: While I was a student there I greatly enjoyed it. The staff was nice, the lessons interesting and a good overall atmosphere. However, the issue I have is their handling with billing and cancellation of memberships. I sent them multiple emails asking to have my membership cancelled yet I received no reply. I have called them multiple times and left voicemails(because, for whatever reason no one picks up) but there is no return of my calls. I even called and talked to Randall, the owner, who said he would make sure to do it. He did not. They proceeded to charge me despite no longer attending and having asked to be cancelled multiple times.

name: Scott Cleveland
text: Great school! I have seen my sons confidence grow as he progresses through the belts, and have no worries about his ability to fully defend himself.  Kids Mid level package breaks down to around 20 one hour classes a month (5 a week) at ~120$, That's 6$ a class. Hands down, the best money  I have ever spent.

resp.text: Thanks!!! We have great kids and parents!

text: This is a great Gym for anyone looking to start jiu jitsu or develop your game to a higher level. Everyone is super friendly and contribute to the clean, family friendly environment. As a jiu jitsu practitioner of 10+ years I really appreciate the depth of knowledge Randall has and his willingness to help others progress. Always a pleasure when ever I can train here.

resp.text: Thanks Jon!! Always good to see you!

name: Jenny Pope
text: My daughter is really enjoying classes here and having such a positive experience!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!

name: Lori Duck

text: The instructors and the culture here are exactly what we need more of in this world. Great program for kids, adults, men and women.

text:

name: Orrin Coufal
text:
Accidentally posted this review on my girlfriends account.

Completed my week trial yesterday. I went 3 out of 4 days and I would have done 4 of 4 but I was tied up on Wednesday. I took Taekwondo classes when I was younger and enjoyed it and I wanted to start now to get healthier and learn some discipline and self defense. I will be signing up next week for sure. The class is taken seriously yet it is fun and you are able to learn a lot. I’m looking forward to progressing with Brister’s Martial Arts.

name: justine ralston
text: Completed my week trial yesterday. I went 3 out of 4 days and I would have done 4 of 4 but I was tied up on Wednesday. I took Taekwondo classes when I was younger and enjoyed it and I wanted to start now to get healthier and learn some discipline and self defense. I will be signing up next week for sure. The class is taken seriously yet it is fun and you are able to learn a lot. I’m looking forward to progressing with Brister’s Martial Arts.

name: David Luders
text: What a great program, he is here to develop anyone who wants to accept the challenge. Great mentor for all who study under him.  Keep up the good work.

name: N L
text: My little one has been going to Brister’s for a couple years now. I can not say enough positive things. They truly love these kids and what they do. They encourage a positive environment and ensure the best for all participants no matter what age and level.

resp.text: Thank you for everything.  We appreciate your support.

name: Ryan Anderson
text: Awesome instructors. They are very good with teaching and molding young students with discipline while still having a light atmosphere for the young ones

resp.text: Ryan, thank you for the kind words.

name: Mark Ratliff
text: The Brister’s are exceptional, kind people that care for their students.  Our son started in Tang Soo Do and tried many local martial arts facilities, they all pale in comparison to the level of instruction and education the students get at Brister’s Martial Arts Academy.  We now have our daughter receiving instruction as well, highly recommend them!

resp.text: Mark, we are glad that you are so satisfied with the program.  It's wonderful having you a part of our system.

name: Addie Hamren
text: Our kids have attended classes at BMAA for 4 years now. We like that our kids are learning self-defense, but it goes way beyond that. They're learning respect, discipline, self control and much more. We highly recommend the Brister's martial arts family!!

resp.text: Thank you, glad to know that they are learning.

name: Liz S
text:
Brister’s Martial Arts Academy provides an excellent program of respect and integrity for Taekwondo. They do not require contracts which is amazing! They understand life happens sometimes. They understand some kids need to take the summer off.
They care and make you feel like family. Our son not only reached his goal of earning his black belt, but his work ethic, ability to accept admonition, to stand in front of peers for testing, and to listen to direction and correction improved 100%. Our daughter is now taking classes and our son (11years old) told us to not let her quit until she gets her black belt. That says a lot!
Even though there are many TKD studios near us we drive 30 minutes to BMAA. We wouldn’t trade a single minute for a closer studio.

resp.text: Thanks you so much for your confidence in our program.

name: Sarah Sandora
text: Wonderful martial arts program! Truly care about their students and offer a personal and professional environment.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, we enjoy having the girls in class.

name: SebCuber
text: Great martial arts studio. Mr Brister is patient, knowledgeable and invested in his students. Mrs Brister makes us all feel like part of their family. I feel like the Taekwondo lessons have made my son more respectful and my daughter able to defend herself.  They are both very excited about the new things they are learning.  I was also very impressed with all the ways Mr. Brister came up with in order for us to stay safe and comfortable during these trying times.

resp.text: Thanks for the kindness, glad to know that we are making a difference.

name: Ben Branham
text: My family has been with Bristers Martial Arts for a year and a half.  My son (7 years old) enjoys the sport and the progressive challenges.  As a parent I also attend the school.  My favorite aspect is that I can take the classes with my son and the two of us can enjoy the sport together.  As a parent I also appreciate the lessons given to kids on how to welcome other kids, how to protect yourself from bullies, and how to protect yourself from an attack by a stranger.  Very good school, and very positive and respectful staff.

resp.text: Ben, Thanks for the kind words.

name: John Sandora
text: Great place for kids to learn the sport and self discipline

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words. We appreciate your support.

name: Nina Soden
text: Both of my kids attend martial arts classes at Brister's Martial Arts Academy. Their self confidence has improved and they take more pride in the things they can do on their own now. I'm very happy that my kids are enjoying their classes and having fun. My son says that he likes that the classes are challenging and he really likes how Mr. Brister helps them learn while having fun.

resp.text: Thanks Nina

name: John Sandora
text: My elementary school age daughters have attended here for over a year and we highly rate both the quality of instruction and the educational environment at Brister’s Martial Arts

name: Josh Johnson
text: My two sons and I have been attending Brister's Martial Art's for about a year and half. The family atmosphere makes for an easy environment to learn, ask questions, and feel safe. The instructors do a great job of teaching and working with the students, both young and old, on learning new techniqes and forms, why they are important and when to use them. We enjoy being a part of BMAA and look forward to being a part of the Academy for a long time to come!

resp.text: Thanks Josh for the great review!

name: Tony Wallace
text: Awesome instructor. Great with young kids.

resp.text: Thanks Mr. Wallace

name: George Strickland
text: Mr. Brister is an amazing instructor dedicated to the pursuit of excellence in each and every student!

resp.text: Thanks for the KIND WORDS!!

name: George Green
text:
I came over from England, and asked to join a session and absolutely loved the place. It has a fantastic atmosphere, lovely people, and has a warm family environment. Professor George, is friendly, and articulates drills & movements very well. I felt extremely welcome! unfortunately I was only able to train a month, and was incredibly sad to stop!

I plan to return as soon as possible, it is a fantastic place.

resp.text:
Looking forward to your return George!!!

See you soon!!!

name: John Willis
text: This place has literally helped me change my life for the good. Mind body and soul are all worked on here. The Professor, George Wehby, is very skilled and knowledgeable and has helped guide me on the way to becoming the best version of myself!

name: Maria Gilbert
text: Had a fantastic birthday party for Jack at Lionheart today. All the kids were engaged, busy, and loved the obstacle course. Thank you George, Dustin and J.D. for making this a fun event for everyone!

name: John McLemore
text:
I've been a member of Lionheart for around 2 years now, and I can't say enough good about it. I've been around combat sports and martial arts for some time now, and Professor Wehby is by far the most superior instructor that I have had the pleasure of learning from.
The atmosphere that's been created at this academy allows beginners to learn without feeling uncomfortable while also pushing the  more advanced students to improve.
Awesome place.

name: Aaron Travis
text: Great place with a great atmosphere.  George is truly passionate about the art and takes a principle approach to teaching.  Perfect environment for the beginner or advanced student.  Become a part of the Lion Heart family!

name: Matthew Denaburg
text: This school provides the perfect blend of a fun, welcoming environment and quality instruction. I have trained in eight different styles at various locations over the past 21 years, and Professor Wehby is by far the most accommodating instructor I have ever had the pleasure of training under. Whether you’re an experienced grappler, a striker who struggles with grappling (like me), or new to martial arts all together, this is the place to be. I truly can’t speak highly enough of Professor Wehby and his academy.

name: Kirk Knudsen
text: Great family atmosphere, wonderful place to train.  Instructors teach the Jujitsu concepts like no where else I’ve been.  I’d give it ten stars if I could.

name: jeremy giadrosich
text: I am a new student and can't say enough good things about both the instructor(George Wehby) or the people/enviroment at this school. George and the class have welcomed me open arms and made my first uncomfortable classes of not knowing anyone both inviting and accepted. I look forward to every class I attend not for just the teaching but also the camaraderie.

name: Randall Phillips
text: George Wehby is a true jiu jitsu gentleman. I have had him down to my school in Auburn to teach a seminar and every student loved having him. He teaches  jiu jitsu concepts that have lasting impressions on students. His character and professionalism in the jiu jitsu community is unrivaled.

name: MrRshirley4
text: Good instruction in jiu jitsu and in our spiritual life also.

name: chris elms
text:
Every single person there was very friendly and welcoming. They all came up, introduced themselves, shook my hand unprompted.
Great place to train.
They even had a blue belt that looked exactly like Brad Pitt with a beard named david.

resp.text:
😂 @ Brad Pitt look alike

Glad you had a great time.
Sorry I missed training with you.

name: Jody V
text: I walked into this gym to just check it out 1 day. I have no prior experience with any martial arts. I like the way George broke every move down step by step & explained why it was done this way. He makes sure all levels of experience are understanding each move. Great place. Very friendly environment from the time I walked through the door. Students & instructor are great. I've been to a few class now & can't wait to go to the next.

name: Nathan Fisher
text: My son and I have both been training under Professor Wehby for about 9 months. Not only have we improved our fitness, but BJJ challenges each of us every session. This allows us to grow together as we each walk our walk in the gym. The instruction is top notch and the culture of the gym is very welcoming and accepting. Please come out and join us!

name: Patrick Norman
text: Hands down the best thing I've ever done for myself! George is a fantastic teacher and really knows how to help you as an individual. Most fun thing you can do to lose weight and learn a skill. It has helped change my life and it can definitely do the same for you!

name: Eddy Parsons
text: My daughter and I trained with Coach George for about a year. We both really enjoyed it and I feel like he helped advance the skill level of both of us. I hope to be able to train with him more in the future.

name: Austin Dobbs
text: Going to Lionheart Academy is one of the best decisions I've made. Really good atmosphere, and a great coach! Its definitely worth looking into.

name: Howard Kersh
text: The Lion Heart Academy has a very welcoming atmosphere and the majority of the students are working professionals.  There is a good mix of male and female students as well as ages and experience levels. I am 42 years old and I am not the oldest or the youngest. The instructor (George) is one of the best BJJ teachers that I have ever trained with.  I travel all over the country for work so I say this having had the opportunity to train at many well-known BJJ schools.  The big difference with George is that he spends a lot of time covering the body mechanics of the technique.  This teaching style makes it very easy to adapt the techniques discussed in class to different scenarios.  The class sizes are small so there is a lot of individualized instruction.  My game has completely evolved since training there.

name: Doug Smith
text: Professor George is an experienced Jiu Jitsu black belt with  the heart of a teacher. Quite a bit of individualized instruction even in group class setting. Everyone is welcomed, and very diversified classes with different sexes, conditioning and experience allows everyone to learn at their own pace without intimidation. Professor George is the best I have trained with. The training facility is new and clean and the rates are very affordable.

name: Ben Jackson
text: George is hands down the best BJJ instructor around. His teaching style is straightforward and easily understood. All of the people at the gym are extremely welcoming and helpful.

name: Josh Taylor
text: George Wehby is one of the best in his craft of Jiu Jitsu! The lessons of character and discipline he has instilled in my son are priceless!!!

name: Kuni Scissum
text: George Wehby is a great instructor with a wealth of knowledge in BJJ, and trains a great group of people that I've been fortunate enough to meet and roll with. Every day I walk in is a challenge to myself to learn, to train hard, and to look for ways to improve. Lion Heart Academy is the place to go to if you want to develop in Jiu-Jitsu and as person overall.

name: Judy Gibb
text: Don't know all that I should know about this faculty trying to get more info

name: Jennifer Kersh
text: As a 40 year old woman who is not and has never been an athlete or sporty or even graceful, I am astonished at how much I enjoy learning a martial art, and specifically, training at the Lion Heart Academy.  I have never done anything like this in my life, even as a child, so it took me years to get up the courage to give this a try and now I sincerely regret not having embarked on this journey much earlier in my life.  Coach George has created an inviting atmosphere of learning, where being open, friendly and respectful is the norm.  He is an extremely good teacher who knows his stuff which is important to me - if I am going to invest in myself and invest in a new skill, I want to learn it correctly and trust that my teacher knows what he is talking about.  There are many schools of BJJ out there and they are not all created equal.  BJJ is an excellent activity for women, I have learned tricks for defending myself against larger men, I am improving my coordination and core strength and I have met new friends.

name: Dustin Gilbert
text: George at the Lion Heart Academy has had a profound effect on the way that I view and practice BJJ (Brazilian Jiu Jitsu). He is a gifted instructor, breaking the subject matter down into ideas and principles, instead of trying to have his students memorize dozens of techniques like the steps to an overly elaborate dance. Great for over 40, out of shape guys like me to get back into shape and have fun doing it. You won't find better martial arts instruction in the Birmingham, Hoover, and Alabama area!

name: William Boutwell
text: Professor George Wehby is one of the most amazing instructors that I have met in my martial arts journey. His ability to understand and communicate the principles and concepts of Jiu Jitsu are unparalleled. If you are in the Birmingham area this is were you need to train. If you are not in the area make the drive. You will be glad you did.

name: Keith Wilson
text: Awesome guy!!! Awesome place!!!!!

name: Seth Nugent
text: The instructor Eric and pretty much everyone there was very knowledgeable and welcoming. I didn't feel out of place whatsoever.  I Definitely recommend.

name: JD Harrill
text: Amazing class with Chuck Mitchell. As a visitor i felt very welcome and the hospitality was great. 10/10

name: ohmie G
text: You gotta check this place out. One of the best gyms I've been too. Solid group of people with a friendly, welcoming and humourous vibe. Very technical and training partners take care of each other. Big matt space. Classes are structured perfectly. My only wish is that the move of the week progressed a little more from day to day, but they are all levels classes and drillers make killers. But don't miss the Friday night leg lock class, that one is a gem 💎 I'm trying to get a job on Huntsville so I can train with Eric and his crew.

name: Sean Smith
text: The instructors are very knowledgeable and work with each person individually to help them grow. The gym is also very welcoming to all ages and skill levels.

name: Tristan Sober

text: I Highly  recommend it for all ages. For kids it teaches self control, self discipline, courtesy, and much more. For adults it keeps you fit, moving, and healthy.

name: Abigail Duke
text: I've been taking for about 12 years and I call it my "second home" because the people there are like my family. We train, sweat, and grow together. I encourage everyone to try it out!

name: Trina Holloway
text: Master Lee, Miss Lee and Mister Lee have a special relationship with the youngsters. Not only do they teach Tae Kwon Do, but they also instill other important characteristics such as courtesy and honesty and a competitive spirit. A disciplined but fun atmosphere and the kids love the Lees !

name: Clayton Dalton
text: I have been taking Taekwondo at Dothan Martial Arts Academy for some time know and I LOVE it! The Lee family as well as the other masters here are phenomenal and will not only push you to become better at Taekwondo, but they also genuinely care about you as a person. I would recommend DMAA to anyone and everyone!

name: I K
text: Dothan Martial Arts Academy is an excellent place for kids and adults to learn not only Taekwondo, but most of all respect, patience, courtesy and self control. My son started taking Taekwondo lessons in back in South Korea and this place is the only Taekwondo around that I would recommend. The Lee family does an exceptional job at training, helps by and teaching the kids. One of a kind place!

name: Patrick Daniel
text: Absolutely awesome! Great place to learn self- discipline, focus, strength training and cardio while learning awesome martial arts focused on authentic Korean Tae Kwon Do!

name: Elizabeth Duke

I have watched my children grow in many wonderful ways thanks to Master Lee. He cares about each and every child as an individual. He celebrates their accomplishments and encourages them to do their best! He has helped me with my balance and strength so I can keep up with all my children. Over the years when my husaband was at the top of his Tae Kwon Do career he lost 50 pounds. He has classes for my little 5 year old all the way up to a class for me and my husband. It is a wonderful sport for the whole family to enjoy. Thank you Master Lee and the whole Lee family for all you do!

name: frank baker
text: Dynamic Krav Maga and Fitness is a great place to learn a very practical form of self defense. Every class teaches practical moves that could be used immediately if you were put into a bad situation. The owner, Marty, is a genuinely nice guy who has a passion for teaching self defense. The assistant instructors are very knowledgeable and most have a background in several different martial arts disciplines. The students in the classes are all very friendly and ages and genders vary. The fitness classes also give a great workout and will help you in getting fit for self defense. Overall I highly recommend Dynamic Krav Maga and Fitness. If you're interested in self defense, you can't go wrong with Krav Maga. If you're thinking about trying it, give Marty a call or text and he can set you up with a free class so you can see if it's for you.

name: Brenna Sullivan
text:
I really love this place. I've learned so much about self-defense, my over-all health has improved (fat lost, endurance and lean muscle gained), plus I have a lot of new friends. Marty, the owner, is a great guy and a great instructor. The other instructors are great as well.

(Also, speaking from personal experience- this is a great place for super-out-of-shape recovering couch potatoes to start :p )

name: Neal Evans
text: Matthew is a phenomenal Krav Maga coach and instructor. My sons, who are teenagers, and I started with Vindication last fall, and have been devoted apprentices ever since. You will find all levels of experience in the class: from beginners to students who have already achieved some level of certification in Krav Maga. Women, men, young, and older--all types are of folks are welcome. Matthew provides attention to individual students, while keeping the class challenging and fun for all. Vindication Krav Maga is indeed challenging, but offers great rewards for those who dare!

name: S ONeal
text: Matthew Holder is passionate about Krav Maga and a thorough instructor. If you are interested in self defense and want someone who has the patience and knowledge to help meet your specific needs he's the instructor for you! I highly encourage women who lack defense skills to try some classes. Even a few classes could mean the difference between becoming a victim and going home safe.

name: Andrew Brown
text: I would recommend trying Krav Maga training to just about anyone, including those without any prior self defense experience. started without any background and have been training for about 5 months, and my wife and teenage daughter have also trained for several months. Be prepared to be challenged, physically and mentally, but in a good way and in a safe container. This class is also very physical, so it will double for your movement and exercise needs. The first 2 classes are free...try it out!

name: Christopher Story
text:
Matthew Holder is an excellent instructor for both myself and my young daughter.  He is very patient and thourough particularly with my daughter.  He pushes his students to excel helping them to really get the best benefit from the sessions.

I wholeheartedly recommend Vindication Krav Maga for anyone wanting to gain a very practical and effective self defense education for all ages..

name: Erik Whiting
text:
I feel like there's no better way to spend an hour twice a week than making sure that you're safe during the rest of the week. Matthew Holder at Warrior Krav Maga Birmingham AL is a great humble teacher. He has a lot to teach and classes are always full of useful material.

Hardest part is going. If you haven't gone yet, try it! He's still offering the first class free!

name: Sam Logue
text: Matthew Holder at Warrior Krav Maga in Birmingham Alabama is an incredible instructor! He always helps me improve my form and I'm getting the most killer cardio workout I've ever had during each session. I highly recommend him if you're looking for self defense classes or even just to get some great exercise.

name: William Jenkins
text: Was a great class and in many ways life changing for me, definitely worth giving it a try.

name: Nicholas Holder
text: I really enjoyed the classes I took at this self defense school and I feel confident if anything were to happen I would know  how to handle the situation. I would definitely recommend this krav maga school to everyone. The instructor makes it easy to pick up on and understand  so you can progress really quickly

resp.text: We are proud to have the opportunity to be part of your son's journey! Thank you!

Every person that I can name, will be exceptional, from desk to the mat, to mat and office. So happy to be here.

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Petry! We are so glad you're part of our TKD family!

text: Don't expect to have frown in your face in this place, I am one student from taekwondo and this place is amazing, they used to have a small area near Inverness plaza and they had grown since then, this place is for all ages and has a great team. Master Scarsella and his team are very nice and will help you, they offer a free 3 day class and they'll let you try out if you dicide if you want to join taekwondo. They also have events every month like taekwondo championships and movie night. I been both of them and is really fun. Children can go to movie nights without their parents but the instructors will supervise them and is really fun. The championship is for all ages and for all belts. They take place in a school other than theirs because it is small. They are socially distant and if you don't feel safe doing in person, you can do taekwondo in home on zoom. Can't give the zoom code meeting for reasons but if you join, they will tell you the meeting code and instructions. A fun way and also a dedication to protect your self while having fun altogether!

resp.text: Thank you for the great World Class review! - MSWCTKD

I think it has been great for teaching respect, hard work, and even public performance and confidence!  I would recommend Master Scarsella to anyone who has a child who is interested in martial arts or even just a fun activity. text: January 2019, I entered BJJ as a gift from my parents. Through my time here, I have acquired life changing confidence about myself and have met a lot of great people and formed friendships for many years to come. resp.text: Thank you Logan.  It has been our pleasure to see you grow into a strong young man.  Keep up the hard work.
