resp.text: Thank you for the kind words.

name: Tracy Thomas
text: A welcoming, professional environment, a great program for kids!   They do a great job of making them work hard without them knowing they are working.  It’s a fun, controlled environment for them to learn Jiu Jitsu and discipline.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We are so glad to have you as part of our family here at GB Greystone. We look forward to all that the future has for you as you embark on your jiujitsu journey!

name: M R
text: I cannot say enough good things about this gym. Everything about it is very positive; from the staff to the facility itself. The mats, bathrooms, changing rooms are very clean and I have no qualms about either me or my children rolling around. The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable without any egos or aloofness. My family and I felt welcomed from the moment we walked in. This gym is great for everyone. Got young kids? It's for you. Are you a woman worried about rolling with men? There are plenty of women there and they also hold women only nights. Are you older and out of shape? There are plenty of older folks and you can go at your own pace. Whether your goal is exercise, self-defence, or you just want to have fun, this gym is for you. I'd give it more than five stars if that was an option.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We really appreciate all of the kind words.

name: sheridan park
text: Great place for your whole family!! We are a family of four and our kids love the Professors and Coaches!! Very encouraging atmosphere! You just feel at home!! The support you receive from the staff and fellow practitioners is enough to make you never want to leave! Could not say enough great things about this place! Highly highly recommend!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Sheridan. It really means a lot to us. We are so happy to have you guys as a part of our gym family!

name: Zac Ronk
text: Fantastic gym for BJJ of all levels. Quality professors who are flexible enough to teach at different speeds and understand your goals. Everyone is incredibly friendly, so expect to be welcomed by a lot of people. If you're considering it, do yourself a favor and come in.

resp.text: Thanks so much Zac! Keep up the good work!

name: charles hayden
text: Joining Gracie Barra has changed my life. Way better than a gym membership. I’ve lost over 40 lbs and my wife loves the transformation, both physical and emotional. If you’re looking to get your life and health back I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and thank you for all of the medals you have won for Gracie Barra over the last year.  Keep it up.  With your work ethic you will go far.

name: Jeremiah Davis
text: I’ve tried different workout systems and big box gyms over the years but NOTHING compares to GBBJJ. The one on one coaching (or professoring?) is my favorite part and what makes Gracie Barra stand out for me. From the second you walk in the door it feels like a big family.  I came in with 0 experience but every class is structured with all skill levels in mind and not once have I felt intimidated or out of place.  I strongly urge anyone who is hesitant to just take one class, you’ll be hooked before it ends.

resp.text: Thank you Jeremiah!

name: Dennis Healy
text: If you’ve ever wanted to study martial arts Gracie Barra is the place for you. Immaculately clean facility with a family atmosphere and top notch instruction.

resp.text: Thanks so much Dennis! We try our best to make our gym as welcoming as possible. However, it's the friendships and family that create the positive atmosphere we have today.

name: Colby Dobbins
text: Great staff! Great instruction! Great for kids and adults!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words.

name: Sam Riley
text: This is one of the best places to teach your kids, or adults confidence, strength, and flexibility with Brazilian Jiu Jitsu. Professor Frank, Coach Juliana, and Coach Kim, among others, are some of the best leaders in the industry. You cannot go wrong with Gracie Barra Alabama and the Greystone location.  I highly recommend this group!

resp.text: Thank you Sam.  We are super proud of you for losing 23 lbs in your first two months.  I'm glad you finally took the leap and moved from watching your daughter train, to training with her.  We enjoy having both of you in class.

name: Lisa Marie
text: I LOVE my Gracie Barra Greystone  jiujitsu gym! I’ve learned so much from the focused attention. After a hard day, I know that training jiujitsu will relax me. We have more females training jiujitsu than ever before and women’s training class is filled with laughter and great training partners. Professor Frank and Coaches Kim and Juliana have built a family here at the gym and I’m thankful to be part of this growing crew!

resp.text: Thanks so much Lisa! You're doing a fantastic job, it's great to see how much you've progressed.

name: Kirk Knudsen
text: Very clean gym,  with a welcoming atmosphere,  very skilled and professional staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We are so glad you enjoyed our facility!

name: Void Boido
text: Great place right now i'm doing a sample class but I already love it

resp.text: Great to hear! Thank you so much for the kind words.

name: dione densmore
text: I would highly recommend Yong In to anyone that is looking to either enroll their children in Taekwondo or take lessons themselves.  Master Kim and his staff of instructors are amazing!  They're patient, friendly and just all around great people.  My son has been taking lessons with them since August of 2018 and it has helped him immensely with his concentration, discipline, strength and it's an accomplishment that he's super proud of!  I like that they have work-out equipment there available for parents and students, it gives me a chance to workout while he's in class.

name: Helen Lee
text: Cathy is the sweetest person! She was super friendly when i asked her tooo many questions. The dojang was very clean and i loved the instructor. I would 10/10 recommended for children and adults.

name: Peter Pak
text: Awesome place.  Very equipped.  Master Kim is the real deal.  Very nice family and professional. Highly recommend.

name: Jeanie Ladd
text: Awesome gym and great staff! It's a nice family atmosphere and Master Kim is a very patient and thorough instructer. Highly recommend!

name: Jason Zarrilli
text: Fantastic people! Our son has been here for a few years and it has been an A+ experience the whole time. Great focus on discpline, respect and doing things the right way. Would recommend for young and old alike.

name: hans ford
text: Great place! Very family friendly atmosphere. The kids get great exercise and learn self-discipline. There is also exercise equipment available for parents to use. Highly recommended.

name: John Copeland
text: My daughter has been at this school for almost 1 year. She loves it! She always wants to go to class. The staff and the owners are professional and great!

name: William Brinkley (Ben)
text: We expressed that we weren't sure about signing up for a year long contract because we didn't know if our son would like it or not. The owner assured us we could pay for 1 month and let him know if we wanted to then do a year long contract I'd our son liked it and wanted to do it. Well, he didn't. So, we told the owner thanks but he did not want to pursue it any longer and he said that's ok, at least he knows now. We thanked him for the one month trial and moved on. Well, several months pass and we receive a collection notice regarding a 1yr long contract we had failed to pay--i finally  straightened it out. I wonder how many other people he has duped for $.😡😠

name: Jenny Niles
text: Yong In is great place for Martial Arts! My family and I have been taken classes for two years!! Great people and great place!!

name: Courtney Zarrilli
text: We LOVE Yong In!! Great teachers and the owners are pretty awesome too!

name: Core Strength & Performance (Deven & Heidi Dehnel)
text: Fantastic teachers and great atmosphere. Love the environment!

name: Cathy Kim
text: We care about you.

name: Drew Wolchina
text: I started learning BJJ here with the lunch time class. Since day one I was treated like family and have enjoyed every second here. I would recommend to anyone looking for a gym to either start or continue learning.

name: Devin Walker
text: I started training BJJ at 44 y.o. My son and I love this gym! The training is world-class and the people I train with along with the gym owners and staff are now FAMILY!! I have grown not only in my Jiu Jitsu game but as a person. 10/10

name: Kaye Dufrene
text: I sent my daughter,Virginia Mcghee, here and she has learned so much just yesterday she defeated her bully(her little brother).Thank you to this dojo. Sorry for my daughter she is a little delusional.🤍

name: Mary Wingo
text: My son has been training with this program for the last year and loves it! The instructors are friendly and care for the kids as well as providing individual instruction. This is a safe environment for kids to learn respect, become more disciplined and of course learn various martial arts. My husband and I are so grateful for Yamane’s encouragement and training. Kids very much thrive here.

name: Matthew Hensley
text: Excellent rolls. World class instructors. If I lived in Fairhope this would be school!

name: Joshua Wren
text:
Yamane is a great instructor who holds many of his own medals and trophies for his disciplines. He is very thorough and knowledgeable.

The atmosphere among the instructors and students/training partners is very good. There is a strong work ethic amongst everyone here.

There is a plethora of things to do here to include: Brazilian Jiujitsu, Boxing, Kickboxing, General Fitness, etc.

The training is top notch, as can be seen from the many state championships won by this school.

If you have your doubts, just try them out!

name: Armondo Love
text: I've been training here on and off for the past four years.  The facility, instructors, members, philosophy and competition are outstanding.  I learn something new every day.  If you want to improve your overall strength and fitness, this is the place for you.  If you want to train to compete on a state, national or world championship level...this is still the place for you!! I can't say enough about Mr. Yamane, his staff or the people that train here!!

name: Christian Casallo
text: What a great gym!  The level of instruction and feeling of camaraderie are incredible. I’ve been training here for a few years and this is truly home!

name: Brenna Chambless
text: My boys have been training here for 2 years and have enjoyed it immensely. They have gained confidence, learned new skills, and made many new friends. The program itself is truly one of a kind (at least for this area). My boys have competed in National Championships and placed. I would highly recommend this gym.

name: Jimmy Chambless
text: I started at this gym a couple of months after they opened and never looked back. I've trained at several other gyms before yamane and they don't even compare. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The guys I train with are like family, we are all their because we love our respective arts and help each other to become better. My two sons are in their kids program and love it. They are on their way to becoming skilled Bjj artist thank to Niall and everyone else at our gym.

name: Lance Donnelly
text: This is a great place! I've been here for around 4 years and I've learned so much! Really cheap compared to other gyms and everyone is super nice. We have a great instructor and everyone truly becomes family in a matter of minutes of walking in the building

name: Joshua Thompson
text: This the best gym by far in the area. It is very clean and top notch instruction. Everyone is real nice and is like one big family. One of the best things in our area and for our Comunity

name: sixto Boyer
text: Best BJJ Gym in the area. Very family oriented place, excellent  training. Best training you will get, outstanding instruction, good training partners, always clean and everyone is like family. I would recommended to any one and any age or the entire family.

name: Anh Dang
text: I've been going to Yamane MMA for 2 years now and I have great experience so far, everyone is nice and respectful. I'm not really a gym type of person, I rather stay at home and play gamesome but they make the workout fun and enjoyable. It's worth the money plus I got my lazy butt in shape.

name: Ken L
text: I have been training here for 3.5 years.  Positive environment.  Good instruction.  Good teammates.

name: Bryton Lopez
text: I've been training BJJ and wrestling at YCMMA for about 4 and a half years now and I can highly recommend the gym to everyone. When I started the gym in middle school, I was a chubby kid who had no self confidence. Today, I walk my high school with a new confidence and have become lean and fit. Not to mention the amazing instruction by all coaches, and that feeling of accomplishment winning medals for your team. Yamane is a place for anyone, any age, and joining the gym changed my life for the better.

name: Leo McDermott
text: The entire staff is amazing, committed and eager to help everyone become better at everything they set forth to become.

name: RICK OLIVER
text: Training at Yamane MMA began as a New Years resolution 2014. I was over weight, out of shape, and my daily choices were far less than desired. One year later I have lost 30 pounds, I'm in great physical condition, and my living and eating habits have improved dramatically. I know for certain that my health, attitude, and lifestyle is 100% better due to my training at Yamane MMA. When I began my membership I really didn't know what to expect. After a full year, my opinion is that I couldn't be more pleased. The training is challenging, enjoyable, I always look forward to it, and feel a great sense of accomplishment after every session. The staff at Yamane MMA is very knowledgeable, professional, and takes training to another level. As said, I could not be more pleased, and I highly recommend it to anyone that wants to improve their health, get in shape, learn martial arts, and have fun doing it.

name: Mae Lam
text: If you love martial arts then Yamane MMA is the best place to train not only for competition and to get in the best physical shape but the people there are amazing and accepting of everyone. My personal experience is I went from having a dream in BJJ and MMA  to living that dream if is wasn't for Yamane it would still be a dream but now it is a reality, I'm living my dream winning in tournaments with the training and support I have received with a wonderful surprise bonus that everyone there have become my closest friends

name: Old Account
text: Great place to get conditioned and learn Jiu Jitsu, Wrestling, Boxing, Kick-Boxing, Muay Thai, or just work-out. I got a six-pack from working out and training here and I think its a fun place so it really is a win-win at the end of the day for you at Yamane Championship MMA.

name: J Clanton
text: I'm 70 years old and started training in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu in 2005, not to compete, but to stay in good shape as I got older. I moved to Daphne several years ago and found YCMMA. Having trained at different places over the years, I can say that YCMMA is the best of all of them.  The gym is the cleanest, the schedules are great and Professor Niall's instruction is the most precise and detailed of any other place I've trained. I've made many new friends here and all the students, from the kids to the adults, are great!

name: Joshua Barrington
text: A wonderful place to train with great environment, facilities, excellent trainers and family atmosphere. Out of the other MMA gyms I've been to its the most appropriate for not only seasoned athletes but also the most accomodating for beginners with no experience. I train Muay Thai and BJJ under Coach Nial and he not only keeps it challenging enough for whatever your current level is but also very rewarding and fun. I highly recommend this gym to anyone interested in learning Martial Arts or just getting in the best shape of your life.

name: Pat Greer
text: Great atmosphere! Great instructors!

name: Sharon Billhimer
text: absolutely amazing!!!!! ;)

name: Brittany Satterfield
text: My son had anger and confidence problems before I signed him up. He has been going for several months now and his confidence is better so he has started making friends and his anger is better controlled. The staff is friendly, professional and truly cares about their students. I love that my son is learning the skills to defend himself and that he is making friends at the same time. I would definitely  recommend Premiere to others!

name: Ernestine Adkins
text: Great school! The instructors are awesome and my daughter loves it!

name: Ashley McGowan
text:
Just finished My first Womans self Defense class and Oh My Goodness...I learned alot and signing up..it's a bit of a drive for me but it is well worth it BC it will help save my life and my daughter's life!! Y'all get signed up and learn all that you can !!

Chloe had fun and learned alot herself, hoping to get her signed up for classes too!!

Thank you Michael Vick and Kelsie Mcgowan !!!

name: Jerry Chenault
text: Highly skilled instructors and great, caring people who run a professional school where self-development is incorporated into every physical movement. The instructors are very skilled in tournament weapons and skills as well as those super important, reality-based, self defense skills through Krav Maga.  Master Vick is an experienced trainer in Krav Maga, and even conducts seminars at other schools.

name: Rikki Tha M'Fkn Tikki (LadyArtemiss)
text:
This is by far the worst martial arts school I have ever attended. I joined Premier in October 2012 with Oct-Dec free. I enrolled on the family plan with my 3 children. My children quickly became bored with the short 30 minute classes that they could only attend twice a week. The instructors were good with the kids, it was just the rushed format that was bad. By January only one was left attending. I wasn't any happier with the jujitsu, Krav Maga, or Muay Thai classes. All classes were only 30 minutes as well. This means practically no warm up, rushed instruction, and little to no time to practice technique or spar. To make it worse, because I had some experience in jujitsu ( my main area of interest when I joined) I was handed a book with the curriculum for the night and left to teach students who had attended Premier longer than me on several occasions. So not only was I losing my training time, I was left in an awkward situation. At this point I figured I would just deal with it and not renew my contract when the 6 months were up. In January the owner sold me on joining the Certified Instructor Training Program with promises of additional training outside of normal class times, seminars that would be paid for by my tuition, weekly CIT meetings, and eventually running my own school under the premier name. There were about 4-5 other adults that signed up for this as well. We changed my contract to reflect that my monthly payments would now go to paying the $10,000 tuition for this course. Between signing up in January till April there were only a total of 3 CIT meetings, far from the weekly meetings I was promised. There was no additional training offered. The seminars were all held in either Kentucky or Texas so to attend you had to drive there and get a hotel. That's not so bad I suppose, but then I was told that there would be an additional fee of several hundred dollars to attend. Also I would have to buy all the equipment required for the seminars (which had to be Premier brand). To purchase all of this equipment added approximately $400 (that's with the CIT discount). By March I had come to accept I had been suckered into a joining a McDojo and was now stuck in a contract. I was going to make the most of it. A month or so later the lead instructor came to teach class intoxicated. To the point he was slurring and falling asleep mid sentence while sitting up. After attending the jujitsu class he taught, several of us informed the owner of the instructors condition. He allowed him to continue teaching the remaining classes (Krav Maga and Muay Thai) while he sat in the back and watched. After this I told the instructor that I wanted to cancel my contract. I expressed all of my concerns and disappointments. He assured me that he was going to improve everything and make good on his promises. He asked me to give him another chance and a little time to get things the way they should be. 2 months later the only thing that had changed was that he fired the instructor that was intoxicatedd. There were only 2 CITs left, including me. Everyone else quit showing up. I informed the owner via E-mail, multiple voicemails, and Facebook messenger that I was dropping out. I listed all of the reasons and was very polite. I received no response. I also contacted the billing company, Member Solutions, as per my contract, to cancel. I explained my multiple reasons for wanting to cancel, and they informed me that I could not cancel. The new contract I signed for the CIT program was counted as a loan for $10,000 that I had to pay back before I could cancel. I attempted again, multiple times, to contact the owner about this issue and once again received no response. I am fortunate enough to have a lawyer as a friend to help me beat this scam. However, I would strongly recommend you stay away from this "school".

Sincerely,
Chris Allen

name: Destiny Fitch
text: Great instructor

name: Kristina Adkins
text: my sis loves it

name: Lori McGowan
text: Great Kids and adult classes!!!
